member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:HealthGateway.Admin.Controllers.AuthenticationController.GetAuthenticationData
member.summary: Reads the ASP.Net Core Authentication cookie (if available) and provides Authentication data.
member.remarks: The /api/GetAuthenticationData route has been deprecated in favour of /api/auth/GetAuthenticationData. This API will likely be replaced by client side authentication in the near future and is not meant to be consumed outside of the WebClient.
member.returns: The authentication model representing the current ASP.Net Core Authentication cookie.

member.name: M:HealthGateway.Admin.Controllers.AuthenticationController.Login
member.summary: Performs an OpenIdConnect Challenge.
member.returns: An IActionResult which results in a redirect.

member.summary: Performs the logout of the application.
member.returns: A SignoutResult containing the redirect uri.

member.name: M:HealthGateway.Admin.Controllers.BetaRequestController.GetBetaRequests
member.summary: Retrieves a list of pending beta requests.
member.returns: The invite email.
member.response: Returns the list of beta requests.
the client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.
The client does not have access rights to the content; that is, it is unauthorized, so the server is refusing to give the requested resource. Unlike 401, the client's identity is known to the server.

member.summary: Sends email invites to the beta requets with the given ids.
member.returns: A list of ids of the beta requests that where successfully processed.
member.param: List of beta requests to send invites.
member.response: Returns the beta requests ids that where invited.
the client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.
The client does not have access rights to the content; that is, it is unauthorized, so the server is refusing to give the requested resource. Unlike 401, the client's identity is known to the server.
